long: Meaning: to "end", whether intransitive (to "cease", "be finished", "perish") or transitive (to "complete", "prepare", "consume").  Usage: accomplish, cease, consume (away), determine, destroy (utterly), be (when... were) done, (be an) end (of), expire, (cause to) fail, faint, finish, fulfil, × fully, × have, leave (off), long, bring to pass, wholly reap, make clean riddance, spend, quite take away, waste.  Source: a primitive root;
